NYSSA: No, it enables this. It regulates the climate. It gives Traken unlimited energy. It stores and distributes information. But the power could equally well be used for evil, if we so choose. It is
JANNEUS: To hear heresy from an off-worlder is bad enough. But from a citizen of Traken? Now, you have travelled widely with the Doctor.
NYSSA: Yes, that's right.
HYRCA: I don't understand why you would want to leave the Union.
NYSSA: I. It was not my choice, initially, but I have learned a lot from my travels. And I hope I have helped others solve at least some of their difficulties. Sabian, you help people. You understand, don't you?
SABIAN: I'm a physician because my father is, and has always wanted his son to be.
NYSSA: But you want to help me.
HYRCA: If he wasn't Shayla's apprentice, someone else would be, and they would treat you, and Sabian here would be a horticulturist or a chemist.
NYSSA: But you get satisfaction from your training.
SABIAN: I would leave it if I did not. But I would never leave the Union. I can't even imagine how it is possible to live out there.
SHAYLA: It's been over an hour.
NARTHEX: There's no need to wait here. I'm sure that when Lord Kwundaar has finished with the Doctor that he'll let us
SHAYLA: We go in?
NARTHEX: I suppose we have to.
NARTHEX: He's alive.
SHAYLA: His pulse is. Oh, I think he's got two pulses. They're both very fast.
NARTHEX: Two hearts, eh? Does that mean it's more likely or less likely he'd have a heart attack, do you think?
SHAYLA: We need to get him to your medical facilities.
DOCTOR: (weak) I'll be all right.
SHAYLA: You're awake.
DOCTOR: Of course I am.
NARTHEX: Here, let me help you up.
NARTHEX: You saw his face, didn't you?
DOCTOR: I did.
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: (laughs) He must think very highly of you.
NARTHEX: We're not allowed to look. Nor would we want to.
DOCTOR: Very wise. I'm the Doctor.
NARTHEX: I'm Captain Narthex, commander of this ship.
DOCTOR: Could I trouble you for a seat and a glass of water?
JANNEUS: Sabian, the Fosters watching Shayla's house have seen no sign of either her or the Doctor today.
SABIAN: They are by the northern shores, Consul Janneus.
JANNEUS: What are they doing there? He's meant to be concerned about his ward, and Shayla is meant to be treating her.
HYRCA: It sounds to me like they have abandoned you. Perhaps Shayla has discovered the evil afflicting young Nyssa is contagious?
NYSSA: This is nonsense. Wouldn't she have warned Sabian? Wouldn't she have warned me?
HYRCA: Perhaps she wouldn't. If she felt the risk of remaining too great, she could flee without so much as packing a bag. Shayla is the expert on disease. Her absence speaks volumes.
JANNEUS: Your reasoning is sound. But why take the Doctor with her? Surely, as the source of the disease
HYRCA: Some corruptions of the body have hosts that show no symptoms. They spread more effectively that way.
JANNEUS: But Shayla would be affected herself, surely.
HYRCA: I do not pretend to be an expert, but I do have a solution. We remove the known carrier.
SABIAN: Remove?
HYRCA: Disintegrate. I fear we must disintegrate Nyssa for the sake of all Traken, and we must do so without delay.
NYSSA: No!
JANNEUS: Sit down! The fact is that a cause of peril has been introduced to Traken and
NYSSA: A cause of peril? Consul, you sound like a superstitious savage. You should be ashamed of your, you, ah (rustle of clothes.)
SABIAN: Nyssa. Nyssa!
SHAYLA: What did he do to you?
DOCTOR: We negotiated. He's a particularly adept telepath. Unfortunately, as a Time Lord, I have rather good natural psychic defences.
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: Unfortunately?
DOCTOR: Yes. To get through them he had to push rather hard.
SHAYLA: So he knows everything you do?
NARTHEX: Kwundaar is omniscient already.
DOCTOR: To all practical purposes. He can read minds. As far as I can tell, he can do it across Time and Space. Who knows what his limits are? He's more powerful than I thought, Shayla.
SHAYLA: If he has all your knowledge, what can you offer him?
DOCTOR: I have no idea. That's what we'll be discussing this afternoon, once I'm strong enough to go back. He holds all the cards. If I Knew what he was, where he came from, I might have some leverage. Captain Narthex?
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: He's a god.
DOCTOR: Yes, I see, but where does he come from?
NARTHEX: Who knows that? Not me.
DOCTOR: And if you did, you wouldn't tell me.
DOCTOR: NARTHEx: If I knew, and I don't, it wouldn't make the slightest bit of difference. He's all-powerful, Doctor. You can't defeat God.
DOCTOR: He may, just may, be omniscient, but if he really was omnipotent as well, well, he wouldn't be skulking around this ship, would he? Well, I have to play it the way he wants. Shayla, how long has Nyssa got?
SHAYLA: She will survive the night, but beyond that
NARTHEX: Who's Nyssa? Your daughter?
DOCTOR: Nyssa is my travelling companion. She's fallen ill. Shayla thinks that only Kwundaar has the knowledge to cure her.
NARTHEX: Kwundaar sees all.
DOCTOR: He claims he does, yes. Now it's a matter of coming to terms, hopefully before he kills me.
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: As the honoured guests of Kwundaar, you have the run of the ship until then. I'll assign Anona to see to your needs.
DOCTOR: Thank you.
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to return to my duties.
SHAYLA: I don't trust them.
DOCTOR: Kwundaar is telling the truth. Perhaps not the whole truth, but he convinced me he can cure Nyssa.
SHAYLA: The people here are devious. They look at us when they think we can't see them. They hide things from each other. And they're pirates, murderers.
DOCTOR: They don't have the same advantages that our backgrounds gave us.
SHAYLA: You would excuse them?
DOCTOR: I would help them, if they would let me free them from Kwundaar. But they don't see any other way to live.
SABIAN: Nyssa! Lady Nyssa!
NYSSA: (groans) Sabian, what's the matter?
SABIAN: I'm sorry, but you weren't moving. Your skin is so pale.
NYSSA: You thought I was dead.
SABIAN: (sotto) Yes.
HYRCA: She is recovered?
SABIAN: I told you, she is seriously ill. She must rest. You have to adjourn this inquiry.
HYRCA: Consul Janneus?
JANNEUS: I see no harm in that. We shall reconvene first thing tomorrow morning. Sabian, you are charged with Nyssa's care.
NYSSA: There's no hope for me, is there.
SABIAN: Don't say that, my lady. There is always hope.
NYSSA: You've done all you can for me, though.
SABIAN: Well, the spa. There's a warm spring not far from here. The waters are imbued with warmth from the Source. They have healing properties. They may not cure you, but will ease your pain. We shall go there.
NYSSA: And wait for the inevitable.
SHAYLA: You look exhausted, Doctor.
DOCTOR: The food here is marvellous, don't you think?
SHAYLA: Yes. Almost up to Union standards.
ANONA: I shall inform the chef.
DOCTOR: How old are you, Anona?
ANONA: Eighteen.
SHAYLA: Same as Sabian.
DOCTOR: Tell me, Anona. Why do you serve Kwundaar? Why do you choose to live this way?
ANONA: He provides my body with wealth and my soul with meaning.
SHAYLA: You must see that he is evil? He causes death and destruction. You see what just being in his presence has done to the Doctor.
ANONA: Kwundaar teaches that to repress your feelings and desires is the only true evil.
SHAYLA: On Traken we call that selfishness.
ANONA: My parents died from Falconian plague.
SHAYLA: I'm sorry to hear that, but I don't see how that is my fault.
ANONA: You're both doctors. You know the cure.
DOCTOR: I'm not a medical doctor, well, no, not really.
SHAYLA: I've never come across a case of Falconian plague, but from memory, a small dose of Atolix can inoculate against it. A tincture of liquid Galas treats an existing case.
ANONA: You have that knowledge, but you keep it to yourself. That is selfish. Had my parents served Kwundaar, he would have granted them the cure.
SHAYLA: I can't help everyone. When I do, I wouldn't ask for anything in return.
ANONA: So who was the last person from outside the Union who you did help?
DOCTOR: Ladies, there's no need for raised voices. Anona, I try my best to help people, and the best way to do that is to teach them to help themselves.
ANONA: Exactly as Kwundaar teaches.
DOCTOR: Ah, no, that's not quite what I meant. Let a man sit by your fire and he's warm for the night. Show him how to start a fire, he'll be warm every night.
ANONA: Set him on fire, he'll be warm for the rest of his life.
DOCTOR: This isn't funny, Anona. You depend on Kwundaar. How would you survive without him?
ANONA: Lord Kwundaar sees all, and will live until the end of Time. The question doesn't arise.
DOCTOR: But there is another way. When my negotiations are concluded here, Shayla and I will be returning to the Union. You could come with us.
NARTHEX: Stealing my crew, Doctor?
SHAYLA: Her kind would not be welcome in the Union.
DOCTOR: No, but there are places out there you couldn't dream of. I could tell you about
DOCTOR: some of them.
ANONA: I have all I want here.
SHAYLA: How can you have?
DOCTOR: The offer remains open, Anona.
NARTHEX: We're happy where we are, Doctor.
DOCTOR: As someone's servant? You can't really be happy.
ANONA: Everyone here is here willingly. We serve
ANONA: NARTHExX: I can answer for myself, Lieutenant. Working for Lord Kwundaar means I can provide for my family.
ANONA: I didn't know you had children, Captain.
NARTHEX: You never asked. Three daughters. They get everything I earn here. They live well, go to the best schools. Kwundaar watches over them for me, warns me if they might come to harm.
SHAYLA: And do they know how you earn a living?
SHAYLA: NARTHExX: No. No, they don't. But what they don't know won't harm them, and it does mean I have a very good reason to stay where I am.
DOCTOR: It sounds like you're giving your children a good life.
SHAYLA: You don't have a family, Doctor?
DOCTOR: As a matter of fact
DOCTOR: NARTHEx: I'm afraid, ladies and gentlemen, I have to break up this conversation. Lord Kwundaar has requested your presence, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Ah. I'd hoped to delay a little longer. Well, wish me luck, everyone.
NYSSA: The water is warm, invigorating. Why don't you join me instead of standing over there with your arms crossed?
SABIAN: I am not the patient.
NYSSA: Your patient might faint again. And if I fainted in here, I might drown.
SABIAN: (tuts) I'd better join you. (water movement) You do feel better?
NYSSA: A little. How about you?
SABIAN: Me?
NYSSA: You've hardly slept since I arrived. Tending to me must be tiring work, and I can tell you are worried.
SABIAN: The water is very relaxing.
NYSSA: The design of this building is unusual.
SABIAN: I think it used to be a temple.
NYSSA: A temple?
SABIAN: You know, a place of worship?
NYSSA: I know what a temple is. I just didn't think there were any on Traken.
SABIAN: Oh, there aren't. Not any more. This place is very old, but this is a beautiful building. Well constructed, so they left it standing.
NYSSA: So what's the real explanation for the healing properties of the water?
SABIAN: The interface for the Source is housed in a vault under the Consul chamber.
NYSSA: Yes, I remember it.
SABIAN: But only the Consuls are allowed access to the chamber.
NYSSA: I mean, of course, that I remember where it is.
SABIAN: Ah. Well, the Source interface gives off heat, and that warms an underground
SABIAN: stream that runs beneath the chamber. That comes to the surface several miles downstream, here.
NYSSA: And as well as the heat, the Source imbues the water with beneficial properties.
SABIAN: Concentrating those benefits. You should drink the water, too. There's a fount in the changing room. But you already look a lot better. Your skin has some colour to it now.
NYSSA: You really aren't seeing me at my best.
SABIAN: I er, wish that I could.
NYSSA: But there's nothing you can do, is there.
SABIAN: Oh, my Lady Nyssa, if there was, then I would.
NYSSA: It's all right. I believe in the Doctor. I know he will do all he can to save me. And I know there's nothing you or I can do but wait now, so just stay with me, talk to me.
DOCTOR: Hello? Kwundaar, my business here is urgent.
KWUNDAAR: Watch.
DOCTOR: A map of the galaxy, a star map.
KWUNDAAR: What do you see?
DOCTOR: Well, stars, being a star map.
KWUNDAAR: (laughs) I see darkness. Darkness with tiny pinpricks of light.
DOCTOR: You're one of those people whose glass is always half empty, aren't you, I can tell.
KWUNDAAR: Now what do you see?
DOCTOR: The Traken Union. It's a nice place. I take it you've never been?
KWUNDAAR: Hmm. The Source would burn my flesh, annihilate me. It's a place that stifles such as me, but once, once I walked there in the cool of the evening.
DOCTOR: You did? When was that? Kwundaar? There's a certain conformity there, certainly, but the people of Traken are free to leave and there's much there to admire.
KWUNDAAR: You left Gallifrey to escape such a life.
DOCTOR: There was a bit more to it than that, and whatever my reasons I wouldn't force anyone to do the same as me. The people of Traken have a good life. They are eminent scientists and artists.
KWUNDAAR: They've had it easy. The Source provides security, gives them certainty. They don't realise it's a gilded cage.
DOCTOR: You would destroy them for that, given the chance.
KWUNDAAR: Yes.
DOCTOR: Kwundaar, I hope you're not expecting me to destroy the Union for you. Not even Nyssa's life is worth that.
KWUNDAAR: No. I see your mind. You have destroyed Traken already, in the future, in your past. And for that, I thank you.
DOCTOR: That's hardly fair.
KWUNDAAR: You allowed it to be destroyed.
DOCTOR: I couldn't prevent it. Now, what do I have to do to save Nyssa?
KWUNDAAR: You have seen the Source.
DOCTOR: Yes. Not on this visit, a previous one. It's in the vault below the Consul chamber.
KWUNDAAR: The Source itself is sealed behind a protective screen. Combination, two four five, six eight zero.
DOCTOR: I really don't see the relevance of
KWUNDAAR: If you've been in the chamber, then you know what I'm after.
DOCTOR: Er, no.
KWUNDAAR: Ah, you saw it.
DOCTOR: I'm trying to remember.
KWUNDAAR: Bring it to me. Hand it to me by dawn tomorrow and Nyssa will live. I have boosted her psychic defences. She will not die before then.
DOCTOR: Look, you're going to have to remind me. Kwundaar, if I don't know what I'm supposed to do, then
DOCTOR: A clue would be nice.
SHAYLA: There.
ANONA: What are you doing?
SHAYLA: Your captain has granted us run of the ship.
ANONA: You will stand away from that computer terminal.
SHAYLA: I am adding medical information to your system. Here, look. This is a small medical computer. I carry it wherever I go, and I've downloaded its contents to your computer.
ANONA: What do you gain from that?
SHAYLA: I'm helping you. Helping your people. None of them will die of the conditions that could be easily cured on Traken.
ANONA: You're a fool!
SHAYLA: I am?
ANONA: Less of your enemies will die as a result of this, and you have gained nothing in return.
SHAYLA: Doctor?
DOCTOR: It's all right. He was much more civilised this time. Almost chummy.
SHAYLA: You seem confused.
DOCTOR: I am. I'll explain on the way back.
SHAYLA: We're leaving?
ANONA: The woman stays here.
DOCTOR: That wasn't part of the deal, Kwundaar.
ANONA: I set the terms.
DOCTOR: You do not need to hold a hostage to ensure my cooperation, Nyssa is that hostage, remember?
ANONA: Shayla is not a hostage. She will never be returned. She is to be a plaything, a slave, until her death.
SHAYLA: Doctor!
ANONA: You heard the Greatest Leader. Oh.
SHAYLA: What's happening to her?
DOCTOR: The strain of being Kwundaar's host is taking its toll. Come on, before she recovers.
ANONA: (weak) Wait.
SABIAN: You look a lot better. We could, er, sit together here in the, er, garden, perhaps.
NYSSA: Since we left the spa, I've not even had a headache. Sabian, that's odd. The Tardis has gone.
SABIAN: Consul Hyrca, what is going on?
HYRCA: Nyssa, by order of the Consulate of Traken, you are hereby placed in quarantine until your condition can be fully investigated. Then, the Consulate has authorised use of any necessary remedial action.
NYSSA: Including my disintegration?
HYRCA: If that proves necessary.
SABIAN: But she's no longer ill!
HYRCA: Yesterday Shayla said it would be years before you recovered.
NYSSA: I'm not sure how, but I'm a lot better.
SABIAN: You can see that for yourself.
HYRCA: How?
SABIAN: I don't think it was anything to do with what we did at the spring.
NYSSA: I don't see how to explain it, but ever since then I've not felt ill at all. I've not felt this good for weeks. Has the Doctor come back yet? Where's the Tardis?
HYRCA: We don't know where the Doctor is. His travel machine has been placed in quarantine until such time as it can be disposed of. And the order for your detention still stands, my lady. Apprentice Sabian, you are also to be closely monitored for signs of (pause) illness.
SABIAN: Consul, I have been in close contact with Nyssa for over a day and I haven't felt any symptoms.
HYRCA: (chuckles) The corruption of the spirit must be insidious indeed if you can't even feel it happening.
NYSSA: That logic is ridiculous. I demand to see the Doctor.
HYRCA: Foster Etrayk, take her inside. Neither she nor Sabian are to leave the house.
ETRAYK: Yes, my lord.
DOCTOR: Come on.
SHAYLA: Where are we going?
DOCTOR: Bay four. The merchant ship we came in is there.
SHAYLA: Can you pilot it?
DOCTOR: Oh, I'd have thought so. Come on, through here. Oops, perhaps we won't go that way.
SHAYLA: Down here?
DOCTOR: Why not.
NARTHEX: Anona, come in. Respond. Lieutenant Anona? All units locate the Doctor.
SOLDIER: [OC]: They were just here, sir. Level six.
SOLDIER: NARTHExX: I need to know where they are, not where they were, soldier. Anona, how did they escape?
ANONA: They're heading for the merchant ship. You are not to kill them.
ANONA: NARTHEx: All units converge on cargo bay four. Anona, get down there and coordinate them.
ANONA: (normal) Sir.
SOLDIER: [OC]: We have them.
NARTHEX: Wait a moment, Anona. Where?
SOLDIER: [OC]: Base of the merchant ship. They can't get the hatch to the boarding tube open.
ANONA: (Kwundaar) The Doctor is to be taken alive. (normal) And the woman's life is mine. I'll get down there, Captain.
ANONA: NARTHExX: They aren't going anywhere. That hatch is neutronically sealed. They need access to the command circuit to open it.
SOLDIER: [OC]: We're less than twenty metres away, Captain.
NARTHEX: Right, Doctor.
DOCTOR: The boarding tunnel is through that door.
SHAYLA: Hurry.
DOCTOR: Neutronic lock. Simple enough to open. I'll just use my er. Oh, yes. I was forgetting. Oh well, have to do it the hard way. Let's see now. Bit out of practice.
SOLDIER: [OC]: We're less than twenty metres away, Captain.
SHAYLA: Hurry.
DOCTOR: I'm doing my best, but there are fourteen trillion possible combinations. Give me a minute.
DOCTOR: Oh, I impress myself.
SHAYLA: Hopefully the ship wasn't too damaged when it was attacked.
DOCTOR: A little late to worry about that now.
SHAYLA: Thankfully they've not stripped the ship, just taken its cargo.
DOCTOR: It's worth more intact. Now, let's see.
SHAYLA: You need medical attention. You still haven't recovered from seeing
DOCTOR: Two minutes, once we're clear. Shayla, you see that row of blue buttons? Press them all, would you? Top one first.
SHAYLA: The launch bay door isn't open.
DOCTOR: It's all right, I know. Now, let's see. No time for the computer to calculate the coordinates. Er, there.
SHAYLA: But if the door isn't
DOCTOR: Batteries to power, turbines to speed. Let's see. Er, pitch, roll, yaw. Ah, there we are. Gyre and gimble.
SHAYLA: There are guards firing at us. There, on the monitor. They're in the docking tunnel. I think that girl Anona is one of them.
DOCTOR: So she is. Now where's the er. Ah yes. (comms system) Attention guards, this is the Doctor. I'm terribly sorry I couldn't give you more notice, but the drive is on automatic countdown and will shortly be firing. You have er, eight seconds to clear the area.
SHAYLA: They're retreating. You won't need to shut the engines down. You would have done though, wouldn't you? Doctor?
DOCTOR: Here we go.
SHAYLA: But the hatch is still sealed.
DOCTOR: No need to open the hatch ourselves. It responds to the ship's drive being activated. Simple, really.
SHAYLA: They aren't following.
DOCTOR: Well, firing any sort of hyperdrive in a confined space isn't good for the local atmosphere. Next stop Traken. Full speed ahead!
SHAYLA: And the course back is set?
DOCTOR: Yes, locked into the navigation computers.
SHAYLA: Then it's time for you to rest.
KWUNDAAR: Report.
NARTHEX: The Doctor and the woman have escaped, my Lord. They managed to damage our pad as they did. It will be four hours before repairs are complete.
ANONA: My Lord Kwundaar, I throw myself on your infinite mercy. It was my error, and it almost lead to the Doctor's death.
KWUNDAAR: My infinite mercy?
ANONA: I have obeyed you. I have tried to serve you.
KWUNDAAR: And you have, child.
ANONA: My Lord?
KWUNDAAR: I told you, I have an agent on Traken.
ANONA: Yes, the girl. The Doctor's companion. I forget her name.
ANONA: NARTHExX: Anarissa, wasn't it?
KWUNDAAR: Nyssa.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: You're the reason she is ill. You infected her in the first place.
KWUNDAAR: I reached out, searching for someone who might aid me. My requirements were precise. A native of Traken who was outside the Union. One who'd been exposed to evil. One with the skills or allies who would bring me what I need. Who could bring my restoration. I found Nyssa soon after she started travelling with the Doctor. I entered her mind, released her psychic potential. My power over her has grown steadily stronger.
ANONA: She hears your words in her mind and her dreams, as I do. She's under your control, subject to your whims as I am.
KWUNDAAR: Yes. You object, Captain Narthex. You imagine me doing the same to your daughters, violating their souls, forcing them to give themselves to me. I could do so. I will not.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: Your wisdom is unmatched, my Lord. You clearly understand the situation more fully than I do.
ANONA: Nyssa sees the truth in your words, and, as I do, she is your good and willing servant.
KWUNDAAR: No, she resists. She is a true Daughter of Traken. Her mind would rather destroy itself that yield to me. As I foresaw. And by resisting me, she will destroy herself, as all who resist me are destroyed.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: Then how can she be your agent?
KWUNDAAR: She is not my agent.
ANONA: But
NARTHEX: The Doctor.
KWUNDAAR: Yes.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: The Doctor is your agent?
KWUNDAAR: He will do anything to save his companion. The Doctor thinks he has escaped me. He thinks he's outwitted one who sees and knows all. But he is mine. At dawn tomorrow he will hand me the Source, and Traken will be mine. And then I will have everything. The Doctor will see this and the Doctor will realise the totality of his failure. And then I will kill him.

elements.text: [Part Three]
Doctor, wake up.
Sorry, I nodded off.
We've landed. Oh, the Union is beautiful. I've never really appreciated that before. To see the sun rising over Traken
The sun is setting, I think.
But we're safe from Kwundaar.
Yes, perfectly safe. He can't reach us here. Are we safe from your people, though?
We'll find out soon enough, I think.
Hatch opens.
They've come out to welcome us home. Fosters. Armed Fosters.
And Hyrca and Janneus.
Consuls! How is Nyssa?
Doctor, Shayla, you are under arrest for consorting with the enemies of Traken.
We did no such thing. I was simply fulfilling my duty as a physician. The Doctor was saving the life of his friend.
Do we really have to shout like this? And could you please answer my question?
Nyssa is under house arrest.
(sotto) At least she's alive. Kwundaar seems to be keeping his word. (normal) Can we please see her?
Don't come any closer. Foster Etrayk, scan them.
Yes, my lord.
What are you hoping to find?
Oh, that tickles. Consuls, I can assure you we're not carrying any weapons. On the way back, Shayla checked us for alien pathogens. We pose no risk.
If we contained the merest grain of evil, the Source would have detected it and destroyed us.
You met with Kwundaar?
I did. Shayla did not.
The scan says they are clear.

Consuls, I appreciate your concern, but the only danger in this whole affair has been to my companion, and I believe that the danger has passed. Now, if you'll take me to Nyssa, we won't trouble you any further. We'll get straight in the Tardis and be on our way.
Kwundaar released you?
We escaped.

We will need a full report to examine the implications of this situation. But it does seem apparent that the immediate danger has passed. Doctor, you can't leave before you have spoken to a Consular Board of Inquiry.
Oh, for pity's sake, make up your minds. Do you want us to go or not?
Don't worry, Doctor. This will be over quickly.
We shall convene in the Consul chamber at once.
Can we please see Nyssa first?
Tinny music playing.
Right, that's it. Kick up your heels. No, not like that, like this.
This is ridiculous. Is this really what passes for music and dancing on, where did you say? Earth?
It's the nearest the melody engine can manage. You've got to admit, it's good exercise. Come on, that's right. Now knock your knees together.
Door opens.
Nyssa.
Doctor!
What are you doing, Sabian?
The Chorlton.
Door closes.
Charleston.
It's how they dance on the planet Earth, isn't it, Nyssa?
It's a dance? Can you do that, Doctor?
The mark of a gentleman is that he knows how to Charleston, but doesn't. You're looking a lot better, Nyssa.
It's something you did, isn't it.
Yes.
Thank you.

I can't guarantee it's over, but I know what it is now. Your psychic defences have been eroded. You're vulnerable to outside influence. Now, with a little time, I can teach you some Gallifreyan meditation techniques to boost your resistance.
Here on Traken?

No. That's part of the problem. The Source acts as a perfect barrier, so any natural defence your species had has long been lost. A bit like the way isolated tribes can be susceptible to illnesses that are harmless to the general population. If you're strong enough, we should get away before dawn.
The Consuls are waiting for us, Doctor..
They are indeed. Nyssa, we'll get going straight after that. See if you can get Sabian to master the Charleston by then.
I thought I was nearly there.
No. Lift your arm. That's it.
Fighting.
No, lift your arm! That's it. Keep your guard up. Your left hand.
You broke my nose.
I made it bleed. It's not broken. Now come on. I'm nearly twice your age. This should be easy for you. Don't pull your punches, I'm not.
Help me up.
NARTHExX: Sure. I'll argh! (thud, thud, thud)
Serve Kwundaar. Serve yourself before you serve any other. Second commandment.
NARTHExX: Right, better. Ah, you've got a good right hook.
Thank you. Is this necessary? Oh! The people of Traken are pacifists and they won't be expecting an attack.

NARTHExX: They'll fight to defend their home soil. They've got a lot to lose. And don't forget they don't go in for wide roads. It's all gardens and pathways, so we won't be able to move around our artillery or armoured vehicles. Lord Kwundaar anticipates a lot of hand to hand fighting.
I am ready to fight for Kwundaar. I will die for him.
NARTHExX: The idea isn't to die for our ideals, it's to make sure the enemy die for theirs.
Argh!

And for our god's sake, keep your guard up. That one did break your nose, I'm afraid. You'll forgive me if I don't help you up. I've got preparations to make. I want you back on the control deck in half an hour. This ship and its crew are nowhere near combat ready.
Ow. (cries)
Door opens.
Doctor, please take your seat. You are ready, Shayla?
I am.

We convene in the light of the Source that shines on us all. The purpose of this inquiry is to ascertain the immediate intentions of Lord Kwundaar, and to assess the threat that he may pose to Traken.
Doctor, you met with Kwundaar?
I did. I wished to save Nyssa's life. Shayla and I bought passage on a merchant ship, left the Union, and were quickly intercepted by Kwundaar's men.
It seems clear they have a sophisticated tracking technology, and monitor all ship movements.

Kwundaar is a powerful psychic. He can read minds at a great distance, possibly an interstellar one. He also claims to be able to reach out with his mind through Time. I suggest that rather than technology, Kwundaar uses that mental ability to detect spacecraft coming and going. Such a thing is possible, although very rare. One of the things that puzzles me is who Kwundaar is and where he's from.
That is not your concern.
Oh, it is. Aren't you curious? If we knew who he was and what he wanted and why he wants it, well, we might have some chance of stopping him.
Your insight in these matters is not needed. The Source prevents him from entering the Union.
He said he'd been here once.
Quite impossible. Please continue your account without your speculations.
Well, one of Kwundaar's followers killed the merchant captain
The merchant was not from the Union, and so is outside the scope of this inquiry.
He was a human being!
We are concerned with Kwundaar. Tell us of your meeting with him.
We met alone. Shayla was elsewhere on the vessel.

I concur.

[OC]: Dad?

[OC]: You've not called for ages.

[OC]: Yes.

[OC]: I understand.

Walking.
And that's it, I'm free to go.
They want you gone, Doctor. And they mean what they say. They'll have you both executed if you return.

The Consuls insisted I witness your departure.
If life here is a bit stifling, then you're quite welcome to join us.
I have work here, Doctor, but thank you for the offer.
Footsteps.
Back so soon?
I thought I was in that inquiry forever. Time flies when you're having fun, but now it's time to go.
Tardis door opens.
Goodbye, Sabian. Keep practising the Charleston.
Goodbye, Nyssa. I hope you will visit us again.
We might. The Doctor can't really control the Tardis.
[OC]: Come on, Nyssa.
Thank you for everything you've done.
Tardis door closes, Tardis dematerialises.
Come on, Sabian. No time for moping.
Just coming.
It was strange seeing Traken again.
We're not finished here yet.
But you said
It's something Kwundaar said. Something I didn't mention to Shayla or that silly inquiry. He said that what he wanted was in the vault that contained the Source interface.
What?
That's exactly it, I don't know. And if we leave now, I'd never know. And I don't think I could live with myself, never knowing. Ah, it's not letting me set coordinates.
The Source is well-defended. You'd need a Consular ring to get in, and only then with the consent of the whole Consulate.
There must be another way in. Yes, there. There's a water course, an underground stream.
The spa.
Pardon?
I went to a healing spring. Sabian told me the water was heated by passing close to the Source.
Yes, there it is. It's letting us go there. It'll mean a short swim, but, you can swim? The question's never come up before, has it.
I can swim, but
That's the place. Excellent. Despite what you just said to Sabian, I can fly the Tardis. Now, you find yourself a swimming costume. I'll get a waterproof bag and some things from the tool kit.
The Doctor has gone.
I, I ought to feel relieved, but there is much about this incident that worries me.
The integrity of the Union has been preserved.
And the Doctor's questions about Kwundaar were sound. For as long as we have known, Kwundaar has been there, on the edge of the Union. But why? What does he hope to gain?
It shouldn't concern you. The Source keeps Kwundaar at bay. The Source is infallible, so the Source will always keep Kwundaar at bay.
If the Source is infallible, then why did it not pass judgement on the Doctor? Why leave it to us?
You think our ruling was wrong?
N-no.
Well then. Now, there is a recital this evening with a promising new orator, Marcian. Let us attend that and return Kwundaar to the back of our minds. The matter is settled.
Ah yes, very fetching.
You look silly.
This is the height of fashion on Earth. At least, it was the last time I had cause to go sea bathing. I'm amazed it still fits me.
If we're caught here, the Consuls will have us executed.
So let's not get caught. I've had a quick look. The water course is easily wide enough, and we'll be swimming against the current, but it's quite gentle.
Splashing.
Fascinating architecture.
Sabian thought it was an old temple.
Did he? Yes, I think he was right. I don't think this part started life as a pool. This was probably the sanctum, the most sacred area. I'm not sure what all these ledges are.
Somewhere to put your clothes while your bathing?
Perhaps. Only the priests would be allowed down here. It was probably built because of the healing properties of the water.
No, they come from the Source.
Oh, are you sure?
Yes, Doctor. Once the Source was built, there wouldn't have been any need for a temple. It must be a coincidence.
An odd one.
Doctor, can we concentrate on the more important questions, like how are we going to breathe underwater?
Here. Artificial gills. Not very elegant.
Better than drowning.
Captain on the Bridge.
NARTHExX: Thank you, Anona. How's the nose? Oh well. Right, what's the status of the power grid?
It's at eighty percent capacity.
NARTHExX: Eighty? (comms) Engine room, this is the Captain. What are you doing down there, you've had your four hours.
Static.
And what in hell's name is that?
Fluctuations in the power grid have disrupted many of the ship's systems. Sir, with respect, Kwundaar will provide.
NARTHExX: I beg your pardon?
He is the All-seeing One. When he leads us into battle, he will win the day. We may perish, but the Greatest Leader will prevail.
NARTHEx: If it's all the same to you, I'd rather not perish.

The Union contains no weapons except the Source. If that fails them, they will fall. NARTHEx: I can't believe what I'm hearing. Lieutenant, an unarmed civilian merchant ship has virtually crippled the flagship of the fleet. Remember the fourth commandment?
Sir. Kwundaar helps those who help themselves.
Lieutenant, don't say it, follow it. And the rest of you, we could be going to war at any moment! So why are you all standing around?
Ah, invigorating. Hang on a minute. This laser cutter's a bit crude but it will get this cover off. Don't worry, we'll put everything back the way we found it.
It's an antechamber. The Source should be just through this archway. Yes, it's straight through here. It's beautiful, isn't it? Doctor? Where are you?
I'm here.
You've changed back into your clothes.
What did you think was in the waterproof bag? I'm sorry there wasn't room for yours, but it's lovely and warm in here, so you won't catch a chill.
Well, there's the Source.
Is it a bit more active than in your time?
I think so. I'm not sure. Any idea what we're looking for?
Kwundaar said I'd know it when I saw it. I don't think I can have seen it yet. I'll have a look around. This chamber is very old.
It would have to be. Even this early in Traken's history, the Source has been active for several thousand years.
That long? Still, this chamber is older than that.
How can you possibly know that?

We Time Lords have a knack. Look, you see that pillar? Exactly the same type as those in the bathhouse. And that temple pre-dated the Source, didn't it, so I reckon this place does too. I wonder what it used to be?
Does it matter?
Everything matters, Nyssa. Now what's that around the Source?
A protective screen, I think. I think you control it by using this keypad.
Yes, I see. It allows access.
Shayla? The Doctor has gone?
I saw it with my own eyes. Is something the matter, Consul Hyrca?
The Source is registering unusual activity. It seems that the enemy fleet is taking up new positions.
They do conduct military exercises from time to time. But this does look different. They aren't in war games with each other. They are massing as if to attack us.
Their ships will be destroyed. The Source will obliterate them if they come any closer than their present positions. Kwundaar knows that.
He seems to have forgotten. The war fleet will enter the outer reaches of the Union in two minutes unless it changes course.
There is no threat to us. Not with the Source operating.
The Source is operating.
Then there is no threat.
Doctor, there's hardly anything here. Apart from the Source itself, of course. Kwundaar must have been wrong.
He's omniscient.
Then perhaps he was lying.
No, he wanted me here.
That is the perfect reason we should be in the Tardis, getting as far from this place as possible.
Two minutes more then we go, I promise.
Doctor.
Nyssa, don't you want to know what's going on? Kwundaar is plotting something, something to do with this, so. What do you know about the Source?
Only that this is an avatar, a mere representation of the true Source, the sentient sun that shines down upon the whole Union.
It has intelligence? I wonder if that's it. Kwundaar might be trying to control its mind.
It doesn't have a mind as such. It's a complex organising system, like a computer.
Only using light instead of silicon chips, and channelling an almost infinite amount of energy. Before, you said something about this being, what did you call it? Primeval time?
In this era, there is no Keeper.
So the Source looks after itself. There's no human intervention at all, which is why there's no Source manipulator and no one ever comes down here to do maintenance work.
Why would they? The Source is infallible. Any breakdown is instantly repaired. No one intent on sabotage would get within a billion miles of here.
Whatever Kwundaar wants is in there. It's got to be in the Source itself.
Doctor, what are you doing?

Kwundaar knew the combination. Two four five six eight zero. He can't hope to sabotage the Source. As you say, it would just repair itself. Come in, Nyssa. It's perfectly safe. It's the definition of perfectly safe.
It's vast in here.
Bigger on the inside, to coin a phrase. All that light, all that movement, perfectly choreographed. Information moving in formation.
It's beautiful.
If you like that sort of thing. There's nothing here I can hand to Kwundaar. Those were his words. Bring it to me. Hand it to me by dawn tomorrow and Nyssa will live.
Doctor, I'm sorry you won't find out what he was after, but we really must go before we're caught.
How disappointing. Anyway, you're right. Time to close all this up and lock it again. Two five seven eight nine zero. There you go.
That wasn't the combination.
No, the protective shield was on minimum. I boosted it, made it harder for Kwundaar to get in, to be on the safe side. I'm missing something here, Nyssa.
Let's just get back to the Tardis.
Not that way. There's no need to swim back. We just open this door from the inside then leave through the grove.
But I'm wearing a
It's dark out there. There won't be anyone around.
Kwundaar laughs.
NARTHExX: Alpha section, your response times are still too slow. Run the exercise again.
Fire control, the targeting systems are only operating at seventy percent efficiency.
Move it, people! I ordered this control deck sealed. My Lord. Greatest Leader. I didn't realise. To what do we owe the honour of your presence?
The time is here.
The Doctor has done his work?
He has. Tell your soldiers to take their positions for a full-scale planetary assault. Ready the transmats. The order is given to all commanders. Set course for Traken, maximum speed.
But the Source

No, my Lord. I'm merely hesitating for a moment before I leap off the cliff. (comms) This is Narthex. Launch the attack. Best speed to Traken. No quarter asked, none to be given.
Kwundaar laughs.
It's this way, I think.
I'm cold.
It's not like you to complain, and no one you know can see you, can they?
Doctor? Nyssa, is that you?
Sabian?
Sabian.
But you left. We saw you.
Ah, yes, well, I can explain. The reason is
Someone else is coming.
That's right. The reason is, someone else is coming, and. I'm sorry, Nyssa?
Who goes there? Friend or foe?
It's hardly likely to be a foe, is it, Foster.
You tell me, Doctor. What are the three of you doing here? Why is the young lady dressed like that?
I've just been for a swim, Foster. Is that a crime?
Boom
What was that?
Sounded like shelling.
Shelling?
Bombardment. You must have heard the word, you're Captain of the Guard.
Traken is under attack!
I'm not finished with you. Where are you going?
We're getting under cover, Foster Etrayk. I suggest you do the same.
I have to sound the alarm. You, you stay here.
Running.
Wait. What's going on? I. Friend or foe?
Take a wild guess. You know where the Consul chamber is?
Yes, but
Lead us there.
Stay under cover. They're trying to get to the Source.
We have to do something.
Whoosh, boom!
There goes the spaceport. We have to get back to the Source, barricade the vault.
How?
First things first. Wait, I can hear voices. Listen.
Marching feet stamp to a halt.
We have secured this whole sector, Captain Narthex, including the entrance to the vault.
Good work. Who do you serve, men?
Kwundaar!
Who has won the day?
Kwundaar! Kwundaar!
And whose rule shall last for ever?
Kwundaar! Kwundaar! Kwundaar!

This really doesn't sound promising. I Knew it was our friend Kwundaar behind this, but it doesn't explain how.
Why isn't the Source destroying them?
Why is it so dark?
It's always darkest before dawn.
Nonsense. It's darkest at the midpoint of the night. It grows progressively lighter from then.
A figure of speech, but you're right. The sun should be coming up by now. Er, remind me which way is east?
East?
The direction the sun rises from. Please, can someone just give me the answer?
Behind you. Doctor!
I see it.
The sun is
The sun is black.
I don't understand what's happening.
I know.
What?
You did it. Kwundaar tricked you. You boosted the shielding around the Source.

But instead of stopping Kwundaar from getting in, it's preventing the light of the Source from getting out. And without that light there's nothing to stop Kwundaar invading. And if he gets control of the Source
You've handed him the ultimate power of the universe.
Yes, I rather fear I have.
Kwundaar! Kwundaar! Kwundaar! (etc.)
