ANONA: Fluctuations in the power grid have disrupted many of the ship's systems. Sir, with respect, Kwundaar will provide.
ANONA: NARTHExX: I beg your pardon?
ANONA: He is the All-seeing One. When he leads us into battle, he will win the day. We may perish, but the Greatest Leader will prevail.
ANONA: NARTHEx: If it's all the same to you, I'd rather not perish.
ANONA: The Union contains no weapons except the Source. If that fails them, they will fall. NARTHEx: I can't believe what I'm hearing. Lieutenant, an unarmed civilian merchant ship has virtually crippled the flagship of the fleet. Remember the fourth commandment?
ANONA: Sir. Kwundaar helps those who help themselves.
NARTHEX: Lieutenant, don't say it, follow it. And the rest of you, we could be going to war at any moment! So why are you all standing around?
DOCTOR: Ah, invigorating. Hang on a minute. This laser cutter's a bit crude but it will get this cover off. Don't worry, we'll put everything back the way we found it.
NYSSA: It's an antechamber. The Source should be just through this archway. Yes, it's straight through here. It's beautiful, isn't it? Doctor? Where are you?
DOCTOR: I'm here.
NYSSA: You've changed back into your clothes.
DOCTOR: What did you think was in the waterproof bag? I'm sorry there wasn't room for yours, but it's lovely and warm in here, so you won't catch a chill.
NYSSA: Well, there's the Source.
DOCTOR: Is it a bit more active than in your time?
NYSSA: I think so. I'm not sure. Any idea what we're looking for?
DOCTOR: Kwundaar said I'd know it when I saw it. I don't think I can have seen it yet. I'll have a look around. This chamber is very old.
NYSSA: It would have to be. Even this early in Traken's history, the Source has been active for several thousand years.
DOCTOR: That long? Still, this chamber is older than that.
NYSSA: How can you possibly know that?
DOCTOR: We Time Lords have a knack. Look, you see that pillar? Exactly the same type as those in the bathhouse. And that temple pre-dated the Source, didn't it, so I reckon this place does too. I wonder what it used to be?
NYSSA: Does it matter?
DOCTOR: Everything matters, Nyssa. Now what's that around the Source?
NYSSA: A protective screen, I think. I think you control it by using this keypad.
DOCTOR: Yes, I see. It allows access.
JANNEUS: Shayla? The Doctor has gone?
SHAYLA: I saw it with my own eyes. Is something the matter, Consul Hyrca?
HYRCA: The Source is registering unusual activity. It seems that the enemy fleet is taking up new positions.
SHAYLA: They do conduct military exercises from time to time. But this does look different. They aren't in war games with each other. They are massing as if to attack us.
JANNEUS: Their ships will be destroyed. The Source will obliterate them if they come any closer than their present positions. Kwundaar knows that.
HYRCA: He seems to have forgotten. The war fleet will enter the outer reaches of the Union in two minutes unless it changes course.
JANNEUS: There is no threat to us. Not with the Source operating.
HYRCA: The Source is operating.
JANNEUS: Then there is no threat.
NYSSA: Doctor, there's hardly anything here. Apart from the Source itself, of course. Kwundaar must have been wrong.
DOCTOR: He's omniscient.
NYSSA: Then perhaps he was lying.
DOCTOR: No, he wanted me here.
NYSSA: That is the perfect reason we should be in the Tardis, getting as far from this place as possible.
DOCTOR: Two minutes more then we go, I promise.
NYSSA: Doctor.
DOCTOR: Nyssa, don't you want to know what's going on? Kwundaar is plotting something, something to do with this, so. What do you know about the Source?
NYSSA: Only that this is an avatar, a mere representation of the true Source, the sentient sun that shines down upon the whole Union.
DOCTOR: It has intelligence? I wonder if that's it. Kwundaar might be trying to control its mind.
NYSSA: It doesn't have a mind as such. It's a complex organising system, like a computer.
DOCTOR: Only using light instead of silicon chips, and channelling an almost infinite amount of energy. Before, you said something about this being, what did you call it? Primeval time?
NYSSA: In this era, there is no Keeper.
DOCTOR: So the Source looks after itself. There's no human intervention at all, which is why there's no Source manipulator and no one ever comes down here to do maintenance work.
NYSSA: Why would they? The Source is infallible. Any breakdown is instantly repaired. No one intent on sabotage would get within a billion miles of here.
DOCTOR: Whatever Kwundaar wants is in there. It's got to be in the Source itself.
NYSSA: Doctor, what are you doing?
DOCTOR: Kwundaar knew the combination. Two four five six eight zero. He can't hope to sabotage the Source. As you say, it would just repair itself. Come in, Nyssa. It's perfectly safe. It's the definition of perfectly safe.
NYSSA: It's vast in here.
DOCTOR: Bigger on the inside, to coin a phrase. All that light, all that movement, perfectly choreographed. Information moving in formation.
NYSSA: It's beautiful.
DOCTOR: If you like that sort of thing. There's nothing here I can hand to Kwundaar. Those were his words. Bring it to me. Hand it to me by dawn tomorrow and Nyssa will live.
NYSSA: Doctor, I'm sorry you won't find out what he was after, but we really must go before we're caught.
DOCTOR: How disappointing. Anyway, you're right. Time to close all this up and lock it again. Two five seven eight nine zero. There you go.
NYSSA: That wasn't the combination.
DOCTOR: No, the protective shield was on minimum. I boosted it, made it harder for Kwundaar to get in, to be on the safe side. I'm missing something here, Nyssa.
NYSSA: Let's just get back to the Tardis.
DOCTOR: Not that way. There's no need to swim back. We just open this door from the inside then leave through the grove.
NYSSA: But I'm wearing a
DOCTOR: It's dark out there. There won't be anyone around.
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: Alpha section, your response times are still too slow. Run the exercise again.
ANONA: Fire control, the targeting systems are only operating at seventy percent efficiency.
NARTHEX: Move it, people! I ordered this control deck sealed. My Lord. Greatest Leader. I didn't realise. To what do we owe the honour of your presence?
KWUNDAAR: The time is here.
NARTHEX: The Doctor has done his work?
KWUNDAAR: He has. Tell your soldiers to take their positions for a full-scale planetary assault. Ready the transmats. The order is given to all commanders. Set course for Traken, maximum speed.
NARTHEX: But the Source
KWUNDAAR: You question me?
NARTHEX: No, my Lord. I'm merely hesitating for a moment before I leap off the cliff. (comms) This is Narthex. Launch the attack. Best speed to Traken. No quarter asked, none to be given.
DOCTOR: It's this way, I think.
NYSSA: I'm cold.
DOCTOR: It's not like you to complain, and no one you know can see you, can they?
SABIAN: Doctor? Nyssa, is that you?
DOCTOR: Sabian?
NYSSA: Sabian.
SABIAN: But you left. We saw you.
DOCTOR: Ah, yes, well, I can explain. The reason is
NYSSA: Someone else is coming.
DOCTOR: That's right. The reason is, someone else is coming, and. I'm sorry, Nyssa?
ETRAYK: Who goes there? Friend or foe?
DOCTOR: It's hardly likely to be a foe, is it, Foster.
ETRAYK: You tell me, Doctor. What are the three of you doing here? Why is the young lady dressed like that?
NYSSA: I've just been for a swim, Foster. Is that a crime?
SABIAN: What was that?
DOCTOR: Sounded like shelling.
ETRAYK: Shelling?
DOCTOR: Bombardment. You must have heard the word, you're Captain of the Guard.
NYSSA: Traken is under attack!
ETRAYK: I'm not finished with you. Where are you going?
DOCTOR: We're getting under cover, Foster Etrayk. I suggest you do the same.
ETRAYK: I have to sound the alarm. You, you stay here.
ETRAYK: Wait. What's going on? I. Friend or foe?
ANONA: Take a wild guess. You know where the Consul chamber is?
ETRAYK: Yes, but
ANONA: Lead us there.
DOCTOR: Stay under cover. They're trying to get to the Source.
SABIAN: We have to do something.
DOCTOR: There goes the spaceport. We have to get back to the Source, barricade the vault.
NYSSA: How?
DOCTOR: First things first. Wait, I can hear voices. Listen.
SOLDIER: We have secured this whole sector, Captain Narthex, including the entrance to the vault.
NARTHEX: Good work. Who do you serve, men?
SOLDIERS: Kwundaar!
NARTHEX: Who has won the day?
SOLDIERS: Kwundaar! Kwundaar!
NARTHEX: And whose rule shall last for ever?
SOLDIERS: Kwundaar! Kwundaar! Kwundaar!
DOCTOR: This really doesn't sound promising. I Knew it was our friend Kwundaar behind this, but it doesn't explain how.
SABIAN: Why isn't the Source destroying them?
NYSSA: Why is it so dark?
DOCTOR: It's always darkest before dawn.
NYSSA: Nonsense. It's darkest at the midpoint of the night. It grows progressively lighter from then.
DOCTOR: A figure of speech, but you're right. The sun should be coming up by now. Er, remind me which way is east?
SABIAN: East?
DOCTOR: The direction the sun rises from. Please, can someone just give me the answer?
NYSSA: Behind you. Doctor!
DOCTOR: I see it.
SABIAN: The sun is
NYSSA: The sun is black.
DOCTOR: I don't understand what's happening.
NYSSA: I know.
DOCTOR: What?
NYSSA: You did it. Kwundaar tricked you. You boosted the shielding around the Source.
DOCTOR: But instead of stopping Kwundaar from getting in, it's preventing the light of the Source from getting out. And without that light there's nothing to stop Kwundaar invading. And if he gets control of the Source
NYSSA: You've handed him the ultimate power of the universe.
DOCTOR: Yes, I rather fear I have.
SOLDIERS: Kwundaar! Kwundaar! Kwundaar! (etc.)

elements.text: [Part Four]
Chanting heard faintly.
All is lost. Without the Source there is nothing we can do to defend against these invaders.
(panicking) The spaceport has been destroyed. They've occupied the communication centres, blocked the main thoroughfares.
Running.
Shayla, this is the Consul chamber. There is to be no running in this area.
There are soldiers materialising all over the planet. Foster Etrayk and I barely managed to avoid them. Barricade the doors. We must protect the Consul chamber.
We shall fight to the death.
To the death? Surely it needn't come to that. We, we could split up, protect ourselves, and regroup later.
Sir, the strength of the Union is our, well, our unity. If we lose that, what do we have?

If it is obvious to this humble Foster, then it shouldn't be difficult for a Consul, Hyrca. We must remain together, and must find a way to restore the source. The moment we do that, it will destroy all the invaders.

Yes, Shayla is right. Everyone with evil in their heart will burn in the light of the Source. We must enter the vault and attempt to restore the Source. We must enter the vault and attempt to restore the Source. Consul Hyrca, are you listening?
They aren't trying to get in. Surely they could blast their way through these doors if they were minded to?
They aren't chanting. I don't like this.
Transmat.
Consuls of Traken, I am Narthex, the Chief of Staff of the armies of Kwundaar. Now kneel before your living god.
Stay where you are. Drop your weapon.
You dare to give me an order? Give me that order again. Tell me to my face.
Etrayk screams, then keeps gibbering under the dialogue.

Now the forces of the Greatest Leader have total control of the Union. You're beaten, Consul. I don't care whether you admit it or not. And now, where were we? Ah, Shayla. I'm glad you're safely back. Is the Doctor here? How is his sick friend?
The Doctor has left Traken. Nyssa lives.
For the moment. They're here, Narthex. I can hear the Doctor's devious Time Lord mind. They're close to the vault containing the Source, plotting to defeat me.
Sir, Greatest Leader.

NARTHExX: Secure this chamber, Lieutenant. (comms) All units in the vicinity of the Consul building, be on full alert. A Gallifreyan spy is organising resistance against our occupation. He is known as the Doctor, and there will be a reward for the man who captures him and brings him to the Consul chamber alive.
No, he is to be shot on sight. The Doctor is the only possible threat to our operations.
NARTHExX: My Lord, you said that you wanted to kill him yourself.
Yes, yes. You've done well. I shall watch him die. Now, Consuls, you will open the vault for us.
A true Consul of Traken would rather die than (energy weapon) argh!

Lord Kwundaar teaches that one should always get what one wants. Would you like me to prove that you're a true Consul? I'm happy to. It would also prove I'll kill anyone who disobeys orders. Right, everybody happy? Good. Now, are you going to open the vault?
Here, I'll let you in.
I can't hear fighting.
Maybe we are the only people left to shoot. There are so many soldiers around.
We don't know their numbers.
To invade an entire planet would require
It requires careful planning and a very clear set of priorities. They're concentrating their resources on the Consul building. Ultimately all they need to do is secure the Source.
Surely Kwundaar has that already.

Kwundaar might have physical access, but he doesn't have control of the Source, not yet. At least, not complete control. If the Source was working normally, Kwundaar's men and their ships would have been disintegrated.
And the sun wouldn't be black.

Well, that too. But if Kwundaar had control of it, then he'd have used it to wipe us out. It means we have some time to reach the Source before Kwundaar takes full control. We have to get back to the vault.
There are two entrances. One in the Consul chamber, one in the grove.
There's a third.
More swimming? At least I'm dressed for it.
Are you still complaining about that? I did lend you my coat.
I'm very grateful.
Can someone explain?
It's possible to reach the vault from the spa, if you can swim.
I think we should split up. I'll swim for it. You two get to the grove entrance before Kwundaar's men realise it's there.
What do we do when we're there?
It's okay, Sabian. I've sabotaged the Source before.
You have?
All we have to do is lower the protective screen around the Source. Do that, the Source will do the rest.
Doctor, it makes more sense for me to swim for it, so you and Sabian should head for the grove.
All right. Good luck. Come on, Sabian.
You placed the Source here. Here, of all the places you could have?
Well, yes. Why would we not? This vault leads direct to the Consul chamber.
You don't know the significance of this place. Janneus does. Be sure to ask
her.
This vault is simply where the Source is housed. Wait, the protective screen is blocking the light.
We wouldn't be here if it wasn't. Kill him, Narthex.
No! Wait!
Yes. He's loyal, Narthex. His fear will keep him loyal.
I don't want to die.
Then kneel before me.
Like this?
(chuckles) Yes.
NARTHExX: Sir, now we've secured this vault, what are our objectives?
There's a piece of equipment in my chamber on the flagship. It is to be brought here, under guard. This chamber must be completely secured.
NARTHEx: I'll establish a security cordon and post sentries at the door to this vault. They'll kill anyone who even comes close.
There are two more ways in. That door leads to a nearby grove. There's also access via a nearby temple.
A temple? But we don't have any gods.
You do, Consul Hyrca.
I mean, we didn't. We've not had time to build any temples. We will, I'm sure of it.

It has been converted into a mere bathhouse. Sent Lieutenant Anona there. The Doctor and his companions have divided their forces, and are planning a two-pronged attack. Narthex, you are to bring the Doctor to me. Order your men to kill his companions and anyone else with him.
NARTHEx: Sir.
Now both of you, leave me.
You. Help me pull down this tapestry. It might fetch something, I suppose.
You people are without law.
Tearing of fabric.
On the contrary, Shayla, We follow the law of Kwundaar himself. The purest law in the universe. Impose your will on others, lest they impose theirs on you.
You are barbarians. For a hundred generations the Union of Traken has been a beacon of peace and enlightenment. Every world holds Traken up as a model of civilisation.
And it fell in twenty minutes. Think about that, Consul. You've lost.
You heard your leader. The Doctor is out there somewhere, and he's on our side. He defeated you before, he'll do it again.
Door opens.
Captain Narthex.
Hyrca, are you all right?
Door closes.
I'm unharmed, Janneus. I think we can reason with this Kwundaar. I think we can come to an accommodation. He says you know something, Can you think what that might be?
NARTHExX: Anona, what's our status?
We have complete control of the planet, sir. All praise Kwundaar. The men want to
know
NARTHExX: They want to know what they can loot?
Sir.
Standard spoils of war, Lieutenant. They can take what they like.
Sir, what about the population?
Please show mercy, Captain. You said it yourself, you've won.

Very well. Lieutenant, the people aren't to be mistreated. Just process them, then hold them. The Slaver's Guild has been informed. Their carriers will be here in a few days. Tell the men the less people they shoot, the more revenue there will be for them to share out.
Sir.
Make sure these three are kept here under guard. We may need them handy. Have the Doctor and his collaborators been located?
No, sir.
That's our priority. They've split up. I need you to go after the girl Nyssa.
Shoot to kill?
NARTHEx: If you must.
The streets are empty.
Yes. Looks like we've got a clear run to the grove. Come on.
Wait.
Transmat. Boots on gravel.
Do you recognise that machine they're carrying?

I do, actually. They'll be heading straight to the Consul chamber with it, and it's rather important that they don't get there. If we get separated, try to catch up with it and input the following sequence. One seven five three nine. Got that?
One seven five three nine. Should we try to stop them, or carry on to the grove?
The grove. It'll be unguarded. Let's deal with this problem at the source, so to speak.
NARTHExX: There you are.
Ah, Captain Narthex. Fancy meeting you here. It's a lovely evening, isn't it? The sun's a little black, but other than that.
Energy weapon, thud.
Doctor!
NARTHExX: Relax, it was a stun bolt. (click) It's set to kill now, though.
Don't!
NARTHExX: Not to worry, lad. I'm hardly likely to, am I?
You aren't?
NARTHExX: No. Because I've got to get the Doctor to the Consul chamber, and I'm not carrying him.
Units in the vicinity of the spa building, this is Anona. I have located the Doctor. Wait, not the Doctor. It's some girl wearing the same coat. She's entering the building. She's
not seen me. I'm going in. I want backup.
Stand still.
Ah. Hello.
Where's the Doctor?
I don't know a doctor. I'm Nyssa.
That is the Doctor's Tardis, and you were wearing his coat when you entered this building. Now, tell me.
Oh, er, yes. He's down there.
What?
There's a pipe. It leads to the Source vault. He's just gone in. Here, take a look. Don't worry, the water's lovely and warm.
Don't move.
I wasn't going to. Look, you've got all that armour and that gun. It's not as though I can conceal a weapon in this. I'm barely concealing myself. If I tried something, how long would I last?
Take three steps back.
If you don't hurry, you'll miss him.
Right, I'm coming in. Don't try anything. (splash) Ah!
I'll take that. The water is still imbued with energy from the Source. It must be like acid for you.
It hurts!
Does this have a stun setting? Don't try anything! Tell me how to stun you, or I'll shoot to kill.
You wouldn't.
Energy beam hits stone.
The green switch.
Energy beam.
Ah yes. Good. Now for Kwundaar.
The Doctor groans.
It was a stun blast. You may feel groggy for a while.
Believe me, I know what being knocked out feels like. I should write a paper on the subject. We're in the Consul chamber. Oh, hello, Consul Janneus, Consul Hyrca. You've got matching chains.
You've brought devastation to Traken.
Ah, yes, fair comment. Hopefully I can take it away again. Where's Kwundaar?
He's in the vault, connecting up some sort of device to
It's the Source manipulator. I saw his men bring it down from his ship. It does what it says it does, allows him manual control of the Source.
How long would it take to connect up?
Not long. Say, twenty minutes. How long was I unconscious?
Twenty minutes.
Ah. We may still win this. Sabian could have got away and he knows how to
Sorry, Doctor. I didn't get away.
Ah. I didn't see you there.
Be quiet, you lot.
There's always Nyssa.
What did you just say?
Nothing.
NARTHExX: You said something about Nyssa, your ill friend. Where is she?
She er phoned in sick.
(comms) Anona, come in. Anona, come in, please.
I'm here, sir.
NARTHExX: Lieutenant. Glad you could make it. Where's the girl?
She overpowered me, sir.
You should train your soldiers better, Captain Narthex. NARTHEx: I've been saying the same thing myself. We'll discuss your punishment later, Lieutenant. I have to protect Lord Kwundaar.
Sir.
Oh, no.
Bwahahahahahahaha.
NARTHExX: Greatest Leader, the girl
Nyssa is on her way to kill me. She's overpowered Anona and taken her plasma rifle. Yes, Narthex, that is what you were about to say.
You are the All-Seeing One.
Yes. She's almost here.
Faint words, a stone scrapes. Splash. Wet footsteps.
Get away from the console.
Nyssa.
You, you know me?
Don't you know me? I've been with you for so long, Nyssa.
Since that first time I fainted.

How long ago was that? Sometimes it seems like decades, so much has happened to you since you last set foot on Traken soil. But I was with you long before that. You know that, don't you? You can feel me in your mitochondria.
The cells of my body.
Mmm. I've been with you a very long time, Nyssa. Since your first ancestors. NARTHExX: Put that gun down, Miss.
Stay away or I'll shoot.
Bits of metal fall.
No. My powers are increasing. I can take you apart with my mind like I took apart that gun. But I don't want to. I want you to serve me. I only want you to serve me again.
I, I serve the will of the Kwundaar.
+ KWUNDAAR: The Guiding Hand. I am the Lantern, he is the Light.
What's happening to her?
She is returning to the fold.
How many guards, Sabian?
Two. That female Lieutenant, another on the main door.
There are many more of them outside.
If we were free
We are not free, though, are we. The situation is hopeless. Perhaps we can negotiate with Kwundaar.
To negotiate, Consul Hyrca, you have to have something the other person wants. And if Kwundaar has the Source, what else would he ever need?
Miss Anona, if I might ask, why do you think Kwundaar's doing this?
Ours is not to reason why. We serve his Great Purpose.
It's a fair question, don't you think?
Why take control of the Source? Because it's one of the most powerful machines in the galaxy. In Kwundaar's hands it will become the ultimate weapon.
That's as good an answer as any.
It could be so much more than a mere weapon.

Yes, but even so, with all his knowledge I'm sure he could have built a Source of his own. I'm sure I could, given a century or two and I'm not omniscient. How long has he been waiting for this moment? Any idea, Anona?
This is the culmination of two thousand five hundred and thirty two years worth of preparations.
How do you know that?
So it is written in the sacred Ship's Logs. Generations of crewmen have come and gone, the preparations continued. Today they reach their culmination.
You've not done the maths, have you. Not spotted the coincidence.
+ KWUNDAAR: The power circuits have been connected. The energy grid is charged. The Source is reconfiguring to manual control. One hundred and twenty seconds to completion.
Ah, but the Doctor has worked it out.
The Doctor is here?
He's upstairs in the Consul chamber.
Bring him here. He must witness my triumph.
NARTHExX: But he might interfere with the process.
Nothing the Doctor can do can stop me now. If there was, I would know.
How would you know? Oh, of course. Forgive me.
We don't have much time. How long has the Source been around? Shayla? Hyrca?
I don't know.
A long time.
Hyrca, you old fool. You've forgotten the ritual. The light of the Source has shone down on Traken for a hundred generations.
I remember when I was a boy, it was only ninety eight.
Uncanny.
So, what's a hundred generations? About two thousand five hundred years?
Door opens.
Two thousand five hundred and thirty two years.
Door closes.
So Kwundaar's been skulking on the edge of the Union from the exact time the Source was activated. Quite a coincidence.
There really is no need to pursue this line of enquiry.
What has he been doing all this time?
You're asking the wrong question, Shayla. The question is, what was he doing the day before?
There aren't any questions. Not any more. Kwundaar has control of the Source. He wants you to join him, Doctor.
Narthex, if this is the culmination of Kwundaar's Grand Design, then
You want to be there, Anona. Why not.
I want Shayla there. I want her to check Nyssa's condition.
NARTHExX: Look, this is getting ridiculous. Yes, all right. Wipe that smile off your face, Doctor. There's nothing you can do. Kwundaar's already won. Come on, move it.
Door opens.
Nyssa.
Door closes.
Doctor, I tried to stop him.
It's all right. We'll find a way.
Are you all right?
My illness has passed.
It served its purpose.
Doctor, what is he? I remember him, but I couldn't possibly have met him before.
It's a race memory.
A race memory? How?
You fought the Trakenites, didn't you, Kwundaar? Invaded centuries ago. Twenty five centuries, to be precise. It's why they built the Source as a weapon against you.
No.
No?

KWUNDAAR; I am their god. When the first sons and daughters of Traken walked among the groves and forests, I was there. I was the god of wisdom and learning. My temples were libraries. I lived among them.
We would never have worshipped something so, so foul.
II was a benevolent leader. You don't believe me, but I was. Your ancestors worshipped me with open and joyful hearts.
NARTHExX: But they betrayed you.

Everyone betrays me, Narthex. Everyone. That is my curse. I gave them knowledge. I taught them the language of science, the mother tongue of the universe. I gave them control of their environment. They built paradise, but it was my hand that guided the architects and the masons.
Are you claiming that you built the Source?
The ultimate expression of science.
And when you have that, there's no need for a god. They replaced faith with reason and then they kicked you out.
Do not mock me! Don't you dare mock me! These ungrateful children used the great power of the Source to drive me from their paradise, twisted my form into this.
And then they put the Source in the chamber that had been your inner sanctum.
And converted your temple into a healing spa.
And now I have returned, and the Source will be mine.
It isn't yet.
Kwundaar laughs.
The Source has been corrupted.
It has been restored, and it is under my control. I can feel its light on my face. Narthex, I must enter the Source to complete the process.
NARTHEx: Sir, but the Doctor
The Doctor does not matter. Only I matter now. Kill them.
I must alert the citizens of Traken, and I must start with you, Hyrca, old friend. The senior Consul is trusted with knowledge that would tear the Union apart.
If we are to have any chance of defeating Kwundaar, they must be united.
There is no chance. We have nothing to lose because we have already lost everything.
What are you hiding? Is it something to do with what the Doctor was saying?
Sabian, the senior Consuls have passed down a terrible secret for many generations, and kept it from all the records, even the Source itself.
Something to do with Kwundaar?
You've had contact with Kwundaar? Had some sort of pact that he's broken?
No. Whatever made you think that?
People talk, Consul.
You shouldn't listen to gossip.

In the absence of the facts, people are bound to. Sabian, before the Source, the Consuls of Traken were the High Priests to a dark god. The god of forbidden knowledge, the bringer of fire and the secrets of the universe.
We worshipped gods?
A god. A living god.
A living god? But that's what his followers call. Oh.

Kwundaar inspired the creation of the Source. Once that was ready, our spiritual ancestors, the Priest Consuls, plotted against him, hiding their treachery using the light of the Source, and Kwundaar was driven out. Now he has returned to take his birthright. We have kept restricted knowledge of Kwundaar. We did not wish to cause dissent.
You mean you didn't want to tell people your power was based on betrayal. You didn't want people to question your authority.
You see? Dissent. Imagine if everyone in the Union said such things. There would be no Union.
Loud humming.
That doesn't sound good.
Perhaps it is, for the new order.
You heard Lord Kwundaar, Lieutenant. I assume you can manage to kill them, now they're all chained up?
Charming.
Doctor, what can we do?
Nothing.
Anona, it's not too late.
NARTHExX: Still think you could stop him, Doctor? A little late for that.
We can use the Source manipulator to lock the Source in its current settings,
Anona. If I do that, then Kwundaar couldn't possibly take control.
You could do that?
Yes. All I have to do is type in a number. You'll be free, Anona. Free me and I'll free you. I can stop Kwundaar.
Then you must die.
Energy weapon. Anona cries out.
Narthex, why?
Here, Doctor.
Narthex.
You have to stop him. I knew that you could. That's why I opened the hatch.
The hatch?
Back on the ship. I let you escape. You didn't think you'd guessed the code, did you? There were fourteen trillion possible combinations.
Ah, I see. You've been my guardian angel. Then, thank you.
Kwundaar can't be allowed to. I've got daughters, Doctor. At the very least you have to promise me you'll protect them.
I give you my word. Now we need to be quick. Shayla, see if you can save Anona.
Save her life? She was going to kill you.
She doesn't know any better.
(weak) I still know my duty.
Pardon?
For Kwundaar.
Energy weapon.
She's dead.
And she's destroyed the manipulator.
But without that
Without it, we can't stop Kwundaar.
If it is inevitable that Kwundaar is our new ruler, we Consuls should make the transition of power as painless as possible.
You would hand Traken to the barbarians?
Traken has fallen, young Sabian. We have a duty to protect our citizens.
We cannot change what has passed. We did Kwundaar a great wrong. In many ways, his desire for revenge is natural enough.
I'm sure all that talk of Slaver ships was to scare us.
Slaver ships? Consuls, we have long known Kwundaar as a being of great evil.
Perhaps the Doctor was right. Perhaps evil is relative. The legends say Kwundaar was a great teacher. We might have much to learn from him.
And all those stories about him attacking supply ships, murdering pilots, brainwashing his followers, were they lies too?
No, but Kwundaar is a god, so perhaps we shouldn't judge him by the standards of mortal law.
Yes. Kwundaar knows best.
It's not as bad as I thought.
She's destroyed the whole control panel.
But only the control panel, not the mechanism inside. We can wire in a new keypad. Quick, there must be a storeroom nearby with spare parts. Where? Come on.
I'm thinking.
NARTHExX: There's a keypad on this door to the Consul chamber. Could we disconnect that and use it?
Yes.
NARTHEx: I'll try and get it off.
It's too late, isn't it?
It's never too late, Shayla. But at the moment we're cutting it a bit fine.
Doctor, what are you doing?
Entering the Source. I'll establish a mental link with the Source, delay Kwundaar from taking total control. As soon as I have the advantage, enter the lock-down sequence.
But Kwundaar's too powerful. He'll kill you.
I'll delay him. Nyssa, remember this sequence. It's very important. One seven five three nine. Repeat what I just said.
One seven five three nine.
Good girl. I'll probably only have control fora moment. Enter the code and it'll be locked in place. I'm going in.
Bwahahahahahaha! The Source is mine!
Not quite yet it isn't.
Ah, Doctor. So Narthex betrayed me.
You knew he would?
Yes. And I still allowed it to happen. Do you know why?
Because you're going to kill everyone anyway. Won't you get awfully lonely?
No. The Source will be a beacon. There are immortals out there, Doctor, true immortals. Not just like you, who die and rise again. Exiled gods. I've already summoned them back to our universe.
I've met some of them. I was probably the one who exiled them in the first place.
They will serve me, and we will reshape the universe in my image.
Poor universe, that's all I can say. The Source isn't yours yet. I can fight you. I challenge you, Kwundaar. Your will against mine. I can take control of the Source, make it pure again.
A duel of minds? Very well. You are prepared?
Yes. I can defeat argh.
It is over. I have total control.
No.
I have won.
No. I can stop you. I must.
Darkness. It fills me. I become the light, it becomes me. And so darkness falls. But I see the universe, all of Time and Space, and the whole universe will kneel before me in worship.
I will never kneel
Then die!
No. Nooooooooo0!
The Source is changing.
We've wired in the replacement keypad. As soon as the Doctor has control, we enter the sequence.
I don't think it's the Doctor taking control.
NARTHExX: The Doctor's failed. Look, I can end this for you. One shot, back of the head. I'll make it quick. It's better than serving him, believe me.
The Doctor will defeat him.
O ye of little faith. I'm afraid the Doctor is dead.
Narthex, there's still time. He's struggling to keep control. Don't let him enter the sequence.
Energy weapon.
Not Kwundaar! Aim for the Source manipulator!
Too late!
Narthex cries out.
No. What was that? A sequence? I see. I can use the manipulator. Of course. The Doctor was a fearsome intellect, but he fell like all who oppose me will fall.
I'll fight you. You boosted my psychic abilities, remember? Well, I can use them against you.
No, I removed them.
Nyssa cries out.

What is the lock-down sequence? Two four six. You're trying to trick me. I'm your god, Nyssa of Traken. I see everything. There. One seven five three nine. Yes! The power of the Source, mine now and forever.
I'll fight you.
Will you? Little Nyssa, how long do you think that fight will last? Remember, you can't lie to me.
NARTHExX: Others will fight you.
Ah, Narthex. You betrayed me. What punishment can there be for the man who defies his god? An eternity of pain.
Narthex cries out.
Pick on someone your own size, Kwundaar.
NARTHExX: Doctor.
Doctor?
I think Keeper, under the circumstances, don't you? Forgive me if I don't stand up. I've just got comfortable in this chair.
No! I entered the code. I have control of the Source.
I let you think that, yes.
You tricked me. You tricked me!
Yes, you read Nyssa's mind, but the code I gave her wasn't the right one. It transferred power to whoever was inside the Source. Me.
II can feel the Source at my back. I command it.
Or perhaps that's just what I want you to think.
No!
Would you be able to tell the difference? Well? You tell me.
I will destroy you. Gaze into the face of Kwundaar!
You look worried. Do I?
No, this is impossible.
Look me in the eye, Kwundaar.
(scared) No. No, I can't. I
Look me in the eye!
No!
There. Time to restore the Source to its former glory. Nyssa, would you do the honours with the protective shield?
With pleasure.
Kwundaar, do you have any idea what happens when an irresistible force meets an omniscient mind? Well, if you're really omniscient, of course you do. I do believe it goes something like this.
Kwundaar makes nasty gurgling sounds.
The Source is reactivating! Kwundaar must have control.
No! Merciful Kwundaar, forgive us.
The guards! The guards are dying!
Kwundaar is killing his followers? I renounce Kwundaar. I renounce. No, no, wait. Kwundaar, I bow to your mercy. I prostrate myself.
You're damned if you do and you're damned if you don't, Hyrca.
We must go to the vault and pay homage.
You're fools. I'm getting out of here.
There's nowhere to run to. Come on, Janneus. We don't have much time.
Kwundaar is still gurgling.
You can leave, Kwundaar. Return to your flagship and go.
Never. I will never (incoherent gurgling as far as I'm concerned.) NARTHExX: Yes, I do. Simia, I love you. I love you so much. Forgive me. Forgive me.
No need to worry. You're a good man, Narthex. Your daughters are safe. Kwundaar has been destroyed.
NARTHExX: Thank you.
You're safe.
Doctor, are you all right?
The strain of keeping the Source together is more than I was expecting.
I'll enter the lock-down sequence.
And keep me bonded with the Source forever? I'd rather you didn't.
Then
Shayla?
What?
Someone needs to restore what has been shattered today.
I suppose that I could make a start on that, if I was controller of the Source.
Keeper is a better word, I think. A guiding intelligence. Someone who uses its great power to bring the Union back together.
Yes.
Here, take a seat.
Door opens. Running feet.
Merciful Kwundaar, I throw myself on your infinite mercy.
We will serve you, we will. Where is Kwundaar?
Gone.
Then. Doctor, I only meant to serve my people.
The Source has made its judgement on you, Hyrca. It feels that restoring the Union is more important than retribution.
What's happened to you, Shayla?
I see it. The light. Doctor, it's beautiful.
What's going on?
Shayla just became the first Keeper of Traken.
Well, I don't want to blow my own trumpet, but technically she's the second.
Does it matter?
Not in the slightest. Now, shall we go outside? Dawn should be breaking.
Happy people sounds.
Not joining in the celebrations, Narthex?
I don't belong here.
A lot of your men have done, though.
Hundreds of them survived, possibly thousands.
There's good in everyone.
NARTHExX: I thought I was a goner.
I thought I was, to be honest. We've all done things we've regretted. We all contain the capacity for great good and great evil.
The tinny Charleston music starts up.
Then why did the Source choose me?
I don't know. It moves in mysterious ways, clearly.
Would it be possible for me to stay here, perhaps send for my daughters?
That's really not up to me. I'll certainly put in a good word for you with the Keeper.
Thank you, Doctor. I er, I think I'll see how the others are getting on.
My pleasure.
Footsteps.
Here you are.
I was just about to get going. Nyssa, if you want to stay behind, I'd understand.
Traken is my past.
But you've made good friends here. With Kwundaar gone, you're completely cured. And you'll be safe here. Traken will be safe for many thousands of years.
I'm coming with you, Doctor.
Before you decide, you need to know there was a sting in Kwundaar's tail. He sent out a signal, marked me.
Marked you?
I destroyed Kwundaar, but there are others of his kind. Primeval beings. He rang the dinner gong, summoned them back into our universe, and now they know where to find me.
Find us. Come on. It sounds like we've got work to do.

parts.searchable_dialogue:
HYRCA: All is lost. Without the Source there is nothing we can do to defend against these invaders.
JANNEUS: (panicking) The spaceport has been destroyed. They've occupied the communication centres, blocked the main thoroughfares.
HYRCA: Shayla, this is the Consul chamber. There is to be no running in this area.
SHAYLA: There are soldiers materialising all over the planet. Foster Etrayk and I barely managed to avoid them. Barricade the doors. We must protect the Consul chamber.
ETRAYK: We shall fight to the death.
HYRCA: To the death? Surely it needn't come to that. We, we could split up, protect ourselves, and regroup later.
ETRAYK: Sir, the strength of the Union is our, well, our unity. If we lose that, what do we have?
SHAYLA: If it is obvious to this humble Foster, then it shouldn't be difficult for a Consul, Hyrca. We must remain together, and must find a way to restore the source. The moment we do that, it will destroy all the invaders.
JANNEUS: Yes, Shayla is right. Everyone with evil in their heart will burn in the light of the Source. We must enter the vault and attempt to restore the Source. We must enter the vault and attempt to restore the Source. Consul Hyrca, are you listening?
HYRCA: They aren't trying to get in. Surely they could blast their way through these doors if they were minded to?
JANNEUS: They aren't chanting. I don't like this.
NARTHEX: Consuls of Traken, I am Narthex, the Chief of Staff of the armies of Kwundaar. Now kneel before your living god.
ETRAYK: Stay where you are. Drop your weapon.
KWUNDAAR: You dare to give me an order? Give me that order again. Tell me to my face.
NARTHEX: Now the forces of the Greatest Leader have total control of the Union. You're beaten, Consul. I don't care whether you admit it or not. And now, where were we? Ah, Shayla. I'm glad you're safely back. Is the Doctor here? How is his sick friend?
SHAYLA: The Doctor has left Traken. Nyssa lives.
KWUNDAAR: For the moment. They're here, Narthex. I can hear the Doctor's devious Time Lord mind. They're close to the vault containing the Source, plotting to defeat me.
ANONA: Sir, Greatest Leader.
ANONA: NARTHExX: Secure this chamber, Lieutenant. (comms) All units in the vicinity of the Consul building, be on full alert. A Gallifreyan spy is organising resistance against our occupation. He is known as the Doctor, and there will be a reward for the man who captures him and brings him to the Consul chamber alive.
KWUNDAAR: No, he is to be shot on sight. The Doctor is the only possible threat to our operations.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: My Lord, you said that you wanted to kill him yourself.
KWUNDAAR: Yes, yes. You've done well. I shall watch him die. Now, Consuls, you will open the vault for us.
JANNEUS: A true Consul of Traken would rather die than (energy weapon) argh!
NARTHEX: Lord Kwundaar teaches that one should always get what one wants. Would you like me to prove that you're a true Consul? I'm happy to. It would also prove I'll kill anyone who disobeys orders. Right, everybody happy? Good. Now, are you going to open the vault?
HYRCA: Here, I'll let you in.
NYSSA: I can't hear fighting.
SABIAN: Maybe we are the only people left to shoot. There are so many soldiers around.
DOCTOR: We don't know their numbers.
SABIAN: To invade an entire planet would require
DOCTOR: It requires careful planning and a very clear set of priorities. They're concentrating their resources on the Consul building. Ultimately all they need to do is secure the Source.
NYSSA: Surely Kwundaar has that already.
DOCTOR: Kwundaar might have physical access, but he doesn't have control of the Source, not yet. At least, not complete control. If the Source was working normally, Kwundaar's men and their ships would have been disintegrated.
NYSSA: And the sun wouldn't be black.
DOCTOR: Well, that too. But if Kwundaar had control of it, then he'd have used it to wipe us out. It means we have some time to reach the Source before Kwundaar takes full control. We have to get back to the vault.
SABIAN: There are two entrances. One in the Consul chamber, one in the grove.
DOCTOR: There's a third.
NYSSA: More swimming? At least I'm dressed for it.
DOCTOR: Are you still complaining about that? I did lend you my coat.
NYSSA: I'm very grateful.
SABIAN: Can someone explain?
NYSSA: It's possible to reach the vault from the spa, if you can swim.
DOCTOR: I think we should split up. I'll swim for it. You two get to the grove entrance before Kwundaar's men realise it's there.
SABIAN: What do we do when we're there?
NYSSA: It's okay, Sabian. I've sabotaged the Source before.
SABIAN: You have?
DOCTOR: All we have to do is lower the protective screen around the Source. Do that, the Source will do the rest.
NYSSA: Doctor, it makes more sense for me to swim for it, so you and Sabian should head for the grove.
DOCTOR: All right. Good luck. Come on, Sabian.
KWUNDAAR: You placed the Source here. Here, of all the places you could have?
HYRCA: Well, yes. Why would we not? This vault leads direct to the Consul chamber.
KWUNDAAR: You don't know the significance of this place. Janneus does. Be sure to ask
KWUNDAAR: her.
HYRCA: This vault is simply where the Source is housed. Wait, the protective screen is blocking the light.
KWUNDAAR: We wouldn't be here if it wasn't. Kill him, Narthex.
HYRCA: No! Wait!
KWUNDAAR: Yes. He's loyal, Narthex. His fear will keep him loyal.
HYRCA: I don't want to die.
KWUNDAAR: Then kneel before me.
HYRCA: Like this?
KWUNDAAR: (chuckles) Yes.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: Sir, now we've secured this vault, what are our objectives?
KWUNDAAR: There's a piece of equipment in my chamber on the flagship. It is to be brought here, under guard. This chamber must be completely secured.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHEx: I'll establish a security cordon and post sentries at the door to this vault. They'll kill anyone who even comes close.
KWUNDAAR: There are two more ways in. That door leads to a nearby grove. There's also access via a nearby temple.
HYRCA: A temple? But we don't have any gods.
KWUNDAAR: You do, Consul Hyrca.
HYRCA: I mean, we didn't. We've not had time to build any temples. We will, I'm sure of it.
KWUNDAAR: It has been converted into a mere bathhouse. Sent Lieutenant Anona there. The Doctor and his companions have divided their forces, and are planning a two-pronged attack. Narthex, you are to bring the Doctor to me. Order your men to kill his companions and anyone else with him.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHEx: Sir.
KWUNDAAR: Now both of you, leave me.
ANONA: You. Help me pull down this tapestry. It might fetch something, I suppose.
SHAYLA: You people are without law.
ANONA: On the contrary, Shayla, We follow the law of Kwundaar himself. The purest law in the universe. Impose your will on others, lest they impose theirs on you.
JANNEUS: You are barbarians. For a hundred generations the Union of Traken has been a beacon of peace and enlightenment. Every world holds Traken up as a model of civilisation.
ANONA: And it fell in twenty minutes. Think about that, Consul. You've lost.
JANNEUS: You heard your leader. The Doctor is out there somewhere, and he's on our side. He defeated you before, he'll do it again.
ANONA: Captain Narthex.
JANNEUS: Hyrca, are you all right?
HYRCA: I'm unharmed, Janneus. I think we can reason with this Kwundaar. I think we can come to an accommodation. He says you know something, Can you think what that might be?
HYRCA: NARTHExX: Anona, what's our status?
ANONA: We have complete control of the planet, sir. All praise Kwundaar. The men want to
ANONA: know
ANONA: NARTHExX: They want to know what they can loot?
ANONA: Sir.
NARTHEX: Standard spoils of war, Lieutenant. They can take what they like.
ANONA: Sir, what about the population?
SHAYLA: Please show mercy, Captain. You said it yourself, you've won.
NARTHEX: Very well. Lieutenant, the people aren't to be mistreated. Just process them, then hold them. The Slaver's Guild has been informed. Their carriers will be here in a few days. Tell the men the less people they shoot, the more revenue there will be for them to share out.
ANONA: Sir.
NARTHEX: Make sure these three are kept here under guard. We may need them handy. Have the Doctor and his collaborators been located?
ANONA: No, sir.
NARTHEX: That's our priority. They've split up. I need you to go after the girl Nyssa.
ANONA: Shoot to kill?
ANONA: NARTHEx: If you must.
SABIAN: The streets are empty.
DOCTOR: Yes. Looks like we've got a clear run to the grove. Come on.
SABIAN: Wait.
SABIAN: Do you recognise that machine they're carrying?
DOCTOR: I do, actually. They'll be heading straight to the Consul chamber with it, and it's rather important that they don't get there. If we get separated, try to catch up with it and input the following sequence. One seven five three nine. Got that?
SABIAN: One seven five three nine. Should we try to stop them, or carry on to the grove?
DOCTOR: The grove. It'll be unguarded. Let's deal with this problem at the source, so to speak.
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: There you are.
DOCTOR: Ah, Captain Narthex. Fancy meeting you here. It's a lovely evening, isn't it? The sun's a little black, but other than that.
SABIAN: Doctor!
SABIAN: NARTHExX: Relax, it was a stun bolt. (click) It's set to kill now, though.
SABIAN: Don't!
SABIAN: NARTHExX: Not to worry, lad. I'm hardly likely to, am I?
SABIAN: You aren't?
SABIAN: NARTHExX: No. Because I've got to get the Doctor to the Consul chamber, and I'm not carrying him.
ANONA: Units in the vicinity of the spa building, this is Anona. I have located the Doctor. Wait, not the Doctor. It's some girl wearing the same coat. She's entering the building. She's
ANONA: not seen me. I'm going in. I want backup.
ANONA: Stand still.
NYSSA: Ah. Hello.
ANONA: Where's the Doctor?
NYSSA: I don't know a doctor. I'm Nyssa.
ANONA: That is the Doctor's Tardis, and you were wearing his coat when you entered this building. Now, tell me.
NYSSA: Oh, er, yes. He's down there.
ANONA: What?
NYSSA: There's a pipe. It leads to the Source vault. He's just gone in. Here, take a look. Don't worry, the water's lovely and warm.
ANONA: Don't move.
NYSSA: I wasn't going to. Look, you've got all that armour and that gun. It's not as though I can conceal a weapon in this. I'm barely concealing myself. If I tried something, how long would I last?
ANONA: Take three steps back.
NYSSA: If you don't hurry, you'll miss him.
ANONA: Right, I'm coming in. Don't try anything. (splash) Ah!
NYSSA: I'll take that. The water is still imbued with energy from the Source. It must be like acid for you.
ANONA: It hurts!
NYSSA: Does this have a stun setting? Don't try anything! Tell me how to stun you, or I'll shoot to kill.
ANONA: You wouldn't.
ANONA: The green switch.
NYSSA: Ah yes. Good. Now for Kwundaar.
SHAYLA: It was a stun blast. You may feel groggy for a while.
DOCTOR: Believe me, I know what being knocked out feels like. I should write a paper on the subject. We're in the Consul chamber. Oh, hello, Consul Janneus, Consul Hyrca. You've got matching chains.
HYRCA: You've brought devastation to Traken.
DOCTOR: Ah, yes, fair comment. Hopefully I can take it away again. Where's Kwundaar?
JANNEUS: He's in the vault, connecting up some sort of device to
DOCTOR: It's the Source manipulator. I saw his men bring it down from his ship. It does what it says it does, allows him manual control of the Source.
SHAYLA: How long would it take to connect up?
DOCTOR: Not long. Say, twenty minutes. How long was I unconscious?
SHAYLA: Twenty minutes.
DOCTOR: Ah. We may still win this. Sabian could have got away and he knows how to
SABIAN: Sorry, Doctor. I didn't get away.
DOCTOR: Ah. I didn't see you there.
NARTHEX: Be quiet, you lot.
DOCTOR: There's always Nyssa.
NARTHEX: What did you just say?
DOCTOR: Nothing.
DOCTOR: NARTHExX: You said something about Nyssa, your ill friend. Where is she?
DOCTOR: She er phoned in sick.
NARTHEX: (comms) Anona, come in. Anona, come in, please.
ANONA: I'm here, sir.
ANONA: NARTHExX: Lieutenant. Glad you could make it. Where's the girl?
ANONA: She overpowered me, sir.
SABIAN: You should train your soldiers better, Captain Narthex. NARTHEx: I've been saying the same thing myself. We'll discuss your punishment later, Lieutenant. I have to protect Lord Kwundaar.
ANONA: Sir.
DOCTOR: Oh, no.
KWUNDAAR: Bwahahahahahahaha.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: Greatest Leader, the girl
KWUNDAAR: Nyssa is on her way to kill me. She's overpowered Anona and taken her plasma rifle. Yes, Narthex, that is what you were about to say.
NARTHEX: You are the All-Seeing One.
KWUNDAAR: Yes. She's almost here.
NYSSA: Get away from the console.
KWUNDAAR: Nyssa.
NYSSA: You, you know me?
KWUNDAAR: Don't you know me? I've been with you for so long, Nyssa.
NYSSA: Since that first time I fainted.
KWUNDAAR: How long ago was that? Sometimes it seems like decades, so much has happened to you since you last set foot on Traken soil. But I was with you long before that. You know that, don't you? You can feel me in your mitochondria.
NYSSA: The cells of my body.
KWUNDAAR: Mmm. I've been with you a very long time, Nyssa. Since your first ancestors. NARTHExX: Put that gun down, Miss.
NYSSA: Stay away or I'll shoot.
KWUNDAAR: No. My powers are increasing. I can take you apart with my mind like I took apart that gun. But I don't want to. I want you to serve me. I only want you to serve me again.
NYSSA: I, I serve the will of the Kwundaar.
NYSSA: + KWUNDAAR: The Guiding Hand. I am the Lantern, he is the Light.
NARTHEX: What's happening to her?
KWUNDAAR: She is returning to the fold.
DOCTOR: How many guards, Sabian?
SABIAN: Two. That female Lieutenant, another on the main door.
SHAYLA: There are many more of them outside.
DOCTOR: If we were free
HYRCA: We are not free, though, are we. The situation is hopeless. Perhaps we can negotiate with Kwundaar.
JANNEUS: To negotiate, Consul Hyrca, you have to have something the other person wants. And if Kwundaar has the Source, what else would he ever need?
HYRCA: Miss Anona, if I might ask, why do you think Kwundaar's doing this?
ANONA: Ours is not to reason why. We serve his Great Purpose.
DOCTOR: It's a fair question, don't you think?
SABIAN: Why take control of the Source? Because it's one of the most powerful machines in the galaxy. In Kwundaar's hands it will become the ultimate weapon.
ANONA: That's as good an answer as any.
SHAYLA: It could be so much more than a mere weapon.
DOCTOR: Yes, but even so, with all his knowledge I'm sure he could have built a Source of his own. I'm sure I could, given a century or two and I'm not omniscient. How long has he been waiting for this moment? Any idea, Anona?
ANONA: This is the culmination of two thousand five hundred and thirty two years worth of preparations.
DOCTOR: How do you know that?
ANONA: So it is written in the sacred Ship's Logs. Generations of crewmen have come and gone, the preparations continued. Today they reach their culmination.
DOCTOR: You've not done the maths, have you. Not spotted the coincidence.
NYSSA: + KWUNDAAR: The power circuits have been connected. The energy grid is charged. The Source is reconfiguring to manual control. One hundred and twenty seconds to completion.
KWUNDAAR: Ah, but the Doctor has worked it out.
NYSSA: The Doctor is here?
NARTHEX: He's upstairs in the Consul chamber.
KWUNDAAR: Bring him here. He must witness my triumph.
KWUNDAAR: NARTHExX: But he might interfere with the process.
KWUNDAAR: Nothing the Doctor can do can stop me now. If there was, I would know.
NARTHEX: How would you know? Oh, of course. Forgive me.
DOCTOR: We don't have much time. How long has the Source been around? Shayla? Hyrca?
